meanings.definition: To make (something) pagan in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: The ancient statue was paganized with colorful flowers during the festival.
meanings.sent2: The traditional ceremony was paganized with the addition of new rituals.
meanings.sent3: The modern twist on the play paganized the classic story in a fun way.
meanings.sent4: Her unique art style paganized the mundane objects into mystical creations.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant decorations paganized the room into a magical wonderland.

meanings.sent1: The missionary successfully paganized many villagers in the remote tribe.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruler paganized his subjects to follow the new religion.
meanings.sent3: The persuasive speaker managed to paganize the entire audience with his words.
meanings.sent4: She jokingly said she would paganize her friends into joining her quirky club.
meanings.sent5: The charismatic leader had the ability to paganize even the most skeptical individuals.

meanings.definition: To become pagan in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the once traditional festival paganized into a lively celebration.
meanings.sent2: The peaceful village slowly paganized as new beliefs and practices emerged.
meanings.sent3: The old book seemed to paganize itself with mysterious symbols appearing on its pages.
meanings.sent4: The garden gradually paganized with the growth of exotic plants and statues.
meanings.sent5: As the music played, the atmosphere paganized into a joyful and carefree mood.
